definitions: remove something completely so that it no longer exists or cannot be recovered
erase or remove recorded information from a computer system or storage device
examples: Please delete the unnecessary files to free up storage space
She decided to delete all photos from that painful memory
The administrator can delete user accounts from the company database
Be careful not to delete important documents by mistake

definitions: make something clearer or easier to understand by explaining or providing more information
remove impurities or solid matter from a liquid to make it clear and pure
examples: Could you clarify what you mean by that statement please
The teacher clarified the assignment requirements for confused students
The chef clarified the butter by removing all milk solids
You need to clarify the broth before serving the consomm√©

definitions: act in accordance with rules, regulations, wishes or commands given by someone in authority
examples: All employees must comply with the company's safety regulations strictly
The manufacturer refused to comply with the new environmental standards

definitions: make a hole in something using a rotating cutting tool or similar device
practice something repeatedly to achieve proficiency or automatic response
train people through repeated exercises especially in military or emergency contexts
examples: The dentist will drill into the tooth to remove decay
Workers drilled through concrete to install the new pipes
Students drill vocabulary words every morning to improve retention
The pianist drills difficult passages until they become second nature
The sergeant drilled new recruits in formation marching all afternoon
Fire wardens drill employees on evacuation procedures every three months

definitions: give something valuable or desirable to someone in recognition of their achievement or service
provide positive consequences to encourage or reinforce desired behavior or actions
examples: The company rewards top performers with bonuses and promotions annually
Her parents rewarded good grades with extra screen time privileges
The trainer rewards the dog immediately after it follows commands correctly
Life often rewards those who persist through difficult challenges patiently

definitions: take and hold something firmly with the hand or hands
understand or comprehend something fully especially complex ideas or concepts
examples: The baby grasped her mother's finger with surprising strength
He grasped the rope tightly as he climbed the cliff
It took months to grasp the complexity of quantum physics
She quickly grasped the implications of the new policy changes

definitions: make something warmer by applying energy or exposing to a heat source
become more intense emotionally especially in anger or passion during discussion
examples: Heat the soup on medium flame for about ten minutes
The sun heats the earth's surface during daylight hours naturally
The debate heated up when they discussed controversial political topics
Tempers heated as the negotiation reached its most critical point

definitions: arrange or organize things into groups or categories based on shared characteristics
officially designate information or documents with a security level restricting access
examples: Scientists classify animals based on their evolutionary relationships and characteristics
The library classifies books using the Dewey Decimal System consistently
The government classified the documents as top secret immediately
Military officials classify information according to national security sensitivity levels

definitions: officially make something into law through formal legislative or governmental process
perform or act out a story, play or situation especially in dramatic fashion
examples: Congress enacted new environmental protection laws despite strong opposition
The city council enacted stricter parking regulations effective next month
Students enacted scenes from Shakespeare during the drama festival enthusiastically
The children enacted their favorite fairy tale for visiting grandparents

definitions: throw or distribute things over a wide area in random or irregular pattern
move quickly in different directions especially to escape danger or avoid something
examples: The wind scattered autumn leaves across the entire front yard
She scattered flower seeds throughout the garden bed evenly
The crowd scattered when police arrived with riot gear
Birds scattered from the tree when the cat approached stealthily

definitions: measure or record the duration that something takes using a timing device
plan or choose when something should happen for maximum effectiveness or impact
examples: The coach timed each runner during the hundred meter sprint
Scientists carefully time chemical reactions in laboratory experiments precisely
She timed her announcement perfectly for maximum media coverage impact
Investors try to time the market to maximize their profits

definitions: cut something into thin flat pieces using a sharp blade or knife
move through something smoothly and effortlessly like a blade cutting through
examples: Please slice the bread into even pieces for sandwiches
The chef sliced vegetables with precision using her sharp knife
The boat sliced through calm waters leaving barely a ripple
Her words sliced through his excuses like a hot knife

definitions: mix two or more substances together thoroughly until they form a uniform mixture
combine different elements so they merge together harmoniously without sharp distinctions
examples: Blend all smoothie ingredients until completely smooth and creamy
The chef blended spices to create her signature seasoning mix
The architect blended modern design with traditional elements beautifully
Their voices blend perfectly when they sing together in harmony

definitions: express disagreement, disapproval or opposition to something especially formally or officially
examples: Several senators object to the proposed changes in healthcare policy
The defense lawyer objected to the prosecutor's line of questioning

definitions: allow something to exist or happen without interference even if disliked
bear or endure something unpleasant or difficult without giving up or complaining
examples: The school doesn't tolerate bullying under any circumstances whatsoever
She tolerates her noisy neighbors because confrontation seems too difficult
Some plants tolerate drought conditions better than others naturally
He couldn't tolerate the pain without taking prescribed medication

definitions: follow behind someone or something especially to track or observe their movements
be behind or losing in a competition, race or comparative measurement
examples: The detective trailed the suspect through crowded city streets carefully
Smoke trailed from the chimney on the cold winter morning
Our team trails by ten points at halftime unfortunately
The incumbent candidate trails in all recent opinion polls significantly

definitions: die or cause death by being unable to breathe underwater or in liquid
overwhelm or overpower something completely making it impossible to notice other things
examples: The lifeguard prevented the child from drowning in the pool
Many sailors drowned when the ship sank during the storm
Loud music drowned out their conversation at the party completely
She felt drowned by endless work responsibilities and family obligations

definitions: travel on water in a boat or ship especially one powered by wind
move smoothly and effortlessly through air or space like a sailing vessel
examples: They plan to sail around the world in their yacht
Vikings sailed across the Atlantic Ocean centuries before Columbus
The ball sailed over the fence for a home run
She sailed through the exam without any difficulty whatsoever

definitions: teach someone knowledge or skills through systematic explanation and demonstration
tell someone what they must do giving clear orders or detailed directions
examples: The professor instructs graduate students in advanced research methods
She instructs beginners in yoga at the community center
The judge instructed the jury to disregard that testimony
Please instruct the delivery team to use the back entrance

definitions: take a sudden sharp breath especially from surprise, shock or strong emotion
breathe with difficulty taking quick labored breaths when struggling for air
examples: The audience gasped when the magician made her disappear
She gasped in horror at the shocking news report
The runner gasped for air after finishing the marathon
Fish gasp when taken out of water seeking oxygen desperately

definitions: cause someone to feel very enthusiastic, eager or emotionally aroused about something
stimulate something to increased activity especially in scientific or technical contexts
examples: The upcoming concert excites fans who waited years for reunion
New discoveries in space exploration excite scientists around the world
The laser excites atoms to produce coherent light beam emission
Certain wavelengths excite fluorescent molecules making them glow brightly

definitions: cover or become covered with water especially where it's normally dry
arrive or happen in overwhelming quantities that are difficult to manage
examples: Heavy rains flooded the basement causing thousands in damage
The river floods nearby farmland almost every spring season
Complaints flooded the company after the service outage occurred
Memories flooded back when she heard that old song

definitions: legally dissolve a marriage through formal court proceedings ending the marital union
separate oneself completely from something previously connected or associated with
examples: They decided to divorce after twenty years of marriage
The court divorced the couple and divided their assets equally
You cannot divorce actions from their consequences in real life
The company divorced itself from controversial political positions entirely

definitions: jump or move suddenly upward or forward with elastic force or energy
originate or arise from a particular source, cause or beginning point
examples: The cat sprang onto the counter in one graceful leap
The athlete springs over hurdles with incredible speed and agility
Many modern laws spring from ancient philosophical principles fundamentally
Her generosity springs from genuine care for others' wellbeing

definitions: make or cause a loud sharp sound like an explosion or impact
hit or strike something forcefully often making a loud noise
examples: Fireworks bang loudly during the Fourth of July celebration
The door banged shut when strong wind caught it suddenly
Don't bang the dishes together when washing them please
He banged his fist on the table to emphasize his point

definitions: cut into something to remove material and create a desired shape
create an object or design by cutting away material from a larger piece
examples: Use a sharp knife to carve the turkey properly
The river carved a deep canyon through solid rock
Artists carve beautiful sculptures from blocks of marble stone
Children love to carve pumpkins for Halloween decorations annually

definitions: concentrate on and become expert in a particular subject, skill or area of activity
examples: Many doctors specialize in cardiology after completing general training
This restaurant specializes in authentic Thai cuisine using traditional recipes

definitions: refuse to allow something or order someone not to do something
make something impossible or prevent it from happening through circumstances
examples: The rules forbid students from using phones during examinations
Her parents forbid her from dating until she turns sixteen
Time constraints forbid us from exploring every possible option
Logic forbids the existence of square circles by definition

definitions: heat liquid until it reaches temperature where it bubbles and turns to vapor
feel extremely angry or agitated about something to an intense degree
examples: Boil water for ten minutes to ensure it's safe to drink
The soup should boil gently not vigorously for best results
His blood boiled when he discovered the betrayal
She was boiling with rage after reading the unfair review

definitions: provide someone or something with necessary items, tools or equipment for a particular purpose
prepare someone with skills, knowledge or qualities needed for particular situations
examples: The hospital equipped every room with modern medical devices
Hikers should equip themselves with proper gear before mountain climbing
Education equips students with critical thinking skills for future success
Experience equipped her to handle challenging negotiations with confidence

definitions: be disloyal to someone who trusts you by acting against their interests
reveal something unintentionally through one's actions, expression or behavior
examples: He betrayed his best friend by sharing confidential secrets
The spy betrayed his country for money and foreign citizenship
Her nervous laugh betrayed the anxiety she tried to hide
His trembling hands betrayed his fear despite brave words

definitions: fall from clouds as drops of water during precipitation weather events
fall or descend abundantly and continuously like falling rain
examples: It might rain this afternoon according to weather forecasts
It rained heavily throughout the night flooding several streets
Confetti rained down on the parade from buildings above
Criticism rained on the company after their data breach

definitions: give something and receive something else in return especially of similar value
convert money from one currency to another at current market rates
examples: The students exchange gifts during the holiday party annually
We exchanged phone numbers before leaving the conference yesterday
You can exchange dollars for euros at the airport
Banks exchange foreign currency at competitive rates for customers

definitions: draw or trace the outer edge or shape of something
give a summary of the main points or general structure of something
examples: The artist outlined the figure before adding colors
Mountains outlined against the sunset created a stunning view
Please outline your proposal in a brief presentation tomorrow
The professor outlined the course requirements on the first day

definitions: forcefully eject saliva or other substance from the mouth
say something in a hostile or contemptuous way showing anger or disgust
examples: Don't spit on the sidewalk as it's unsanitary behavior
The baby spits up milk after feeding too quickly
She spat out the accusation with obvious anger and disgust
He spat curses at his opponent during the heated argument

definitions: fight or engage in combat especially in war or physical confrontation
struggle with determination against something difficult, challenging or harmful
examples: Ancient armies battled for control of strategic territories historically
The two boxers will battle for the championship title tonight
She battles cancer with courage and positive attitude daily
Students battle against time to complete their final exams

definitions: eliminate disease or medical condition restoring someone to complete health
preserve food especially meat or fish through salting, smoking or drying
examples: Scientists hope to cure cancer through advanced genetic therapies
This medication might cure your infection within several days
Farmers cure ham using traditional salt and smoking methods
The meat must cure for several weeks before consumption

definitions: urinate or pass urine from the body as bodily waste elimination
examples: The dog needs to go outside to piss urgently
Drunk people often piss in public which is illegal behavior

definitions: supply or equip with weapons or military equipment for fighting
prepare oneself with necessary tools, knowledge or resources for confrontation
examples: The government decided to arm border patrol agents additionally
Rebels armed themselves with whatever weapons they could find
She armed herself with facts before the important debate
Students arm themselves with knowledge to face future challenges

definitions: carry or move people or goods from one place to another using vehicles
cause someone to feel overwhelming emotion or to imagine being somewhere else
examples: Trucks transport fresh produce from farms to city markets
The company transports goods internationally using cargo ships daily
The beautiful music transported listeners to another world entirely
Reading that novel transported her back to childhood summers

definitions: grow or develop well and vigorously showing healthy strong development
prosper, flourish or be successful especially in favorable conditions or environment
examples: Plants thrive in rich soil with adequate water supply
Children thrive when given love and proper nutrition consistently
Small businesses thrive in supportive community environments with loyal customers
She thrived in her new job with increased responsibilities

definitions: open or spread out something from a folded or closed position
gradually develop or be revealed over time in sequence or stages
examples: Carefully unfold the map to see the entire route
The flower petals unfold as the bud opens slowly
The mystery unfolds gradually keeping readers engaged throughout
Events unfolded rapidly after the shocking announcement yesterday

definitions: cut something into pieces with repeated sharp blows using an axe or knife
reduce something drastically or eliminate it suddenly and severely
examples: Chop the onions finely for the soup recipe please
Lumberjacks chop trees using sharp axes and safety equipment
The company chopped its workforce by thirty percent unfortunately
Budget cuts chopped funding for arts programs this year

definitions: formally propose someone as a candidate for election or honor
officially name or designate someone for a particular role or purpose
examples: Party members nominate their candidate for the presidential election
The committee nominated her for the lifetime achievement award
The president will nominate a new Supreme Court justice
Schools nominate student representatives for the district council annually

definitions: remove a cover or covering from something to expose what's underneath
discover something hidden, secret or previously unknown through investigation or research
examples: Archaeologists carefully uncovered ancient artifacts from the dig site
She uncovered the pot to check if dinner was ready
Journalists uncovered corruption in the city government through investigation
Research uncovered surprising connections between diet and mood

definitions: mark or damage a surface with something sharp or rough
cancel, withdraw or remove something from a list or competition
examples: The cat scratched the furniture with its sharp claws
Don't scratch the mosquito bite or it will get infected
They had to scratch two horses from today's race
Scratch that idea since we don't have enough funding

definitions: make sure or demonstrate that something is true, accurate or justified through checking
examples: Please verify your email address by clicking the confirmation link
Scientists verify experimental results through repeated testing and observation

definitions: receive money, property or title from someone who has died
receive genetic characteristics from one's parents or ancestors through heredity
examples: She will inherit her grandmother's house and jewelry collection
The eldest son inherits the family business by tradition
Children inherit eye color from their parents genetically
Some diseases are inherited through family genetic lines unfortunately

definitions: make great efforts to achieve or obtain something working hard with determination
examples: Athletes strive for excellence through daily training and discipline
We must strive to create a more inclusive workplace environment

definitions: help or support someone making it easier for them to do something
provide resources, equipment or assistance especially in emergencies or difficulties
examples: Nurses aid doctors during complex surgical procedures consistently
Good lighting aids concentration when studying late at night
International organizations aid disaster victims with food and shelter
Government programs aid small businesses with loans and grants
